channel.title: What do you think of my new computer?
channel.description:
Well I've just bought this for 4 payments over 4 months of £137.55
The make is Lenovo and my experience of using them and what I've heard, they're the original best. My laptop is currently Lenvo also. The desktop has a touchscreen and the following:
•Intel Core i3-550M Processor (3.2 GHz) •21.5" 16:9 touchcreen with fingertip technology •1 TB (Tera byte) Hard Disk and large 4GB memory (ram) •Digital TV Tuner with access to Digital Freeview channels •WiFi Certified Network Connection •Integrated Lenovo High-Sense webcam •Lenovo Enhanced Experience for Windows 7 •3 Dimensional (3D) graphic simulator
[center][IMG]http://img808.imageshack.us/img808/8273/compc.png[/img][/center]
What do you think of it?

item.title: What do you think of my new computer?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You could probably build one twice that good for half the price…

Read full topic

item.source: What do you think of my new computer?

item.title: What do you think of my new computer?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:18, topic:385902”][quote author=Kaex link=topic=481659.msg3528691#msg3528691 date=1300002169]

anyways the all-in-one computers are pretty much laptops when you think about it.

Yep, it’s got a mobile version of the i3, my laptop’s i5 kicks i3’s ass.

Gotz an i7 In myn and I finally got it to lag last night lol. Took me writing a script to target the CPU specifically. Kinda specs does the i5 got compared to i5 or i3? Im rather hardware illiterate on more than the basic ram, hdd, abd gfx catd.

So you basically scripted a stress test?
I did one in visual basics once too.

Well, mine’s hyperthreaded so it’s effectively quad core, and just generally better really, often higher clock speed, although, 3.2ghz on an i3 is pretty high.

Well I just think it kicks ass lol. Looks cool IMO.

As suggested by how the PSP looks, looks are nothing, its how it actually works that matters (inside beauty that mom teaches us?), The PSP can be overclocked to 333MHz at most, and yet only has 64MB of ram. The outside of the PSP, however, goes for a sleeker design with a slim (but not trim) figure. Sure, it looks great to others, but when you break down to the inside, is it really? (no offense plz?)

None taken, but a tb oh HDD is good IMO, 4+2 gb of ram is good IMO and a intergrated i7 is good IMO. All inside the beauty of this sexy sleek chargeable desktop. And I got it fairly cheap.
[/quote]
You mean i3? I never said it wasn’t a good computer, although the graphics provide a question. 1TB HDD, does it use desktop or laptop HDDs?[/quote]
Must be laptop, you’d never fit a 3.5" HDD in a machine that slim.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of my new computer?

item.title: What do you think of my new computer?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

im going to guess it’s integrated graphics. but i guess it’s made by nvidia or ati. unless intel has an integrated card that will do 3d(if you go into device manager then click display adapters. that should tell u ur gfx card). we could always do a benchmark search on google i believe. anyways the all-in-one computers are pretty much laptops when you think about it.

edit: with a quick search around this doesnt look exactly the same but it looks like it has close to the same specs, http://shop.lenovo.com/SEUILibrary/controller/e/web/LenovoPortal/en_US/catalog.workflow:item.detail?vt=5&GroupID=243&Code=77121SU&hide_menu_area=true&current-category-id=FFA158AAECE944CD9055899B3280EA36.

Read full topic

@Kaex wrote:

Well I’ve just bought this for 4 payments over 4 months of £137.55

The make is Lenovo and my experience of using them and what I’ve heard, they’re the original best.
My laptop is currently Lenvo also.
The desktop has a touchscreen and the following:

•Intel Core i3-550M Processor (3.2 GHz)
•21.5" 16:9 touchcreen with fingertip technology
•1 TB (Tera byte) Hard Disk and large 4GB memory (ram)
•Digital TV Tuner with access to Digital Freeview channels
•WiFi Certified Network Connection
•Integrated Lenovo High-Sense webcam
•Lenovo Enhanced Experience for Windows 7
•3 Dimensional (3D) graphic simulator

[center][/center]

What do you think of it?
